sparsegl 0.3.0
  • Get started
  • Reference

Plot cross-validation curves produced from a cv.sparsegl object.

plot.cv.sparsegl.Rd

Plots the cross-validation curve, and upper and lower standard deviation curves, as a function of the lambda values used. This function is modified based on the plot.cv function from the glmnet::plot.cv.glmnet() package.

# S3 method for cv.sparsegl
plot(x, sign.lambda = 1, ...)

Arguments

x

Fitted cv.sparsegl() object
sign.lambda

Either plot against log(lambda) (default) or its negative if sign.lambda = -1.
...

Not used.

Details

A plot is produced.

See also

cv.sparsegl().

Examples

n <- 100
p <- 20
X <- matrix(rnorm(n * p), nrow = n)
eps <- rnorm(n)
beta_star <- c(rep(5, 5), c(5, -5, 2, 0, 0), rep(-5, 5), rep(0, (p - 15)))
y <- X %*% beta_star + eps
groups <- rep(1:(p / 5), each = 5)
cv_fit <- cv.sparsegl(X, y, groups)
plot(cv_fit)
